title: Sudan attack: Injured Bangladeshi peacekeepers out of danger, receiving treatment
body: Eight Bangladesh Army peacekeepers wounded in a drone attack on a United Nations peacekeeping base in Sudan are receiving treatment in Nairobi. All the injured are now out of danger, Bangladesh Army said in a social media post today. It said eight Bangladeshi peacekeepers were initially reported injured in the attack on December 13 in the Abyei area, but updated information later confirmed one more hurt, taking the total number to nine. All the injured peacekeepers were given the highest possible medical care and are currently undergoing treatment at Aga Khan University Hospital in Kenya's capital, Nairobi. One of them has already been discharged after completing treatment, it added. The bodies of the six Bangladeshi peacekeepers who were killed in the attack are expected to return to Dhaka on December 20, Bangladesh Army said, adding that funeral rites would be completed with due honour after their return. A separatist armed group carried out the drone attack on the Kadugli Logistics Base under the UN peacekeeping mission in the Abyei area on December 13.
